text:
today on hot thai kitchen we are making the ultimate 
seafood dipping sauce Sawaddee ka welcome to hot

Thai kitchen today I'm going to teach you a super 
easy recipe that might just forever change the way

you eat your seafood we're gonna make something 
called nam jim seafood and nam jim means dipping

sauce and seafood means well seafood so this 
dipping sauce is gonna be the most epic thing you

eat with seafood whether it's crap lobster mussels 
anything pretty much and you can forget drawing

butter and mignonette let's see if you agree 
with me so let's take a look at our ingredients

okay so this is very simple I like to do it in a 
mortar and pestle but you can do this also in a

blender you're making a large amount so basically 
just go in first with the garlic and the chillies

there and then just pound it into a paste so 
you don't get II don't get any surprise chili

chunks now once it's sort of a rough paste kind 
of like this I'm going to add my cilantro stems

actually I'm going to add my palm sugar first 
because I want to pound it so it's got a chance

to dissolve and the moisture from the chilies and 
the garlic will help dissolve the palm sugar now

when the sugar looks like it's mostly dissolved 
okay we're going to go in with our cilantro stems

and we're using so I pre-chopped them up using 
cilantro stems because the color isn't so dark

and it'll keep the the dip a nicer color I know 
so the leaves tend to they're not actually as

fragrant as the stem is believe it or not so say 
the leaf so when the leaves are required and they

also turn dark after they've been pounded 
so this keeps things nice you can also use

cilantro roots if you have them they'll have 
the same effect I just figure it stems why not

you never use stems the foursomes okay so once 
all that is smushed up I'm gonna go in with our

fish sauce and lime juice and I call for three 
tablespoons because that's about how much lime

juice is in a lime so you know it's an easy 
number to work with so just use an entire lime

and now we're just going to give it a stir I'm 
going to grab a spoon and that's it believe it

or not that is the seafood dipping sauce if 
you've been to Thailand and Thai restaurants

and you order steamed seafood or something 
seafood related you may have had it and it's

really good on anything even non seafood things 
and so notice I only made this much which I know

is not a lot but you don't need a lot this stuff 
is really potent and you don't want to have more

than you need because everything tastes a lot 
fresher when it is just freshly made so let me

show you how awesome this really is so I've got 
this plate of beautifully steamed fresh seafood

here and since I'm the only one eating it I'm 
just going to go ahead and dip into this bowl

so the flavour should lead with sour followed by 
salty and the sweet is just barely there because

seafood generally have natural sweetness in them 
you just wanting to round off the sharp edges of

the acidity and the saltiness I mean this is so 
good what I've also done is skewer shrimp and then

use a pastry brush and brush this whole thing 
onto the shrimp skewer it's so awesome and so

let me know how this goes feel free to adjust of 
the proportion add more cilantro add more garlic

do with this whatever you want sort of the base 
recipe you can start with and play with and let

me know how you like it you can contact me on 
Facebook Twitter Instagram you can also message

me on my website Popeye kitchen com that's 
where the recipe for this will be if you like

the show please click to subscribe and I will 
see you next time for your next delicious time
you
